name: close
javadoc:
/**
 * Closes this connection.
 *
 * This method does nothing and should be overridden by subclasses to perform any necessary cleanup or shutdown operations.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Closes this connection, performing any necessary cleanup or shutdown operations.
 *
 * Subclasses are expected to override this method to implement specific closing logic.
 *
 * @throws Exception if an error occurs during closure
 */

name: mark
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets a mark at the current position, which can be used later to reset the reader's position.
 *
 * @param readAheadLimit The limit of characters that can be read ahead from the marked position.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Sets a mark at the current position in the input stream, allowing for later resetting of the reader's position.
 *
 * @param readAheadLimit  The maximum number of characters that can be read ahead from the marked position without moving the mark.
 */

name: markSupported
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns whether this stream supports marking.
 *
 * A stream that supports marking has a notion of a "current position" or
 * "mark", which can be saved and restored using the {@link #reset()} method.
 *
 * @return true if, and only if, this stream supports marking; false otherwise
 */
improved_javadoc: INVALID FORMAT

signature: public int read(final char[] b, final int off, int len)
name: read
javadoc:
/**
 * Reads characters from this text string builder into an array.
 *
 * @param b   the character array to read into
 * @param off the offset in the array where data will be written
 * @param len the maximum number of characters to read; must not be negative
 * @return the actual number of characters read, or -1 if the end of the text string builder is reached before reading any characters
 * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the specified range of the given array overlaps a range that has already been read, or if the offset and length arguments are invalid
 */
improved_javadoc: INVALID FORMAT

name: ready
javadoc:
/**
 * Checks if the current position is within the bounds of the collection.
 *
 * @return true if the current position is valid, false otherwise
 */

name: reset
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Resets the current position to the last marked position, effectively allowing the reader or writer to revisit previously read or written data.
 *
 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while resetting the position
 */

name: skip
javadoc:
/**
 * Skips over the specified number of elements in this list.
 *
 * @param n the number of elements to skip
 * @return the number of elements actually skipped
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Skips over the specified number of elements in this list, effectively moving the current position 
 * forward by the given amount. If the specified number of elements exceeds the remaining size of the list,
 * it will skip all remaining elements.
 *
 * @param n the number of elements to skip (may be negative)
 * @return the number of elements actually skipped
 */

name: getContent
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the content of this object, or a string representation of this object
 * if the content is null.
 *
 * @return the content of this object, or a string representation of this object
 *         if the content is null
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the content of this object. If the content is null, returns a string 
 * representation of this object.
 *
 * @return the content of this object, or its string representation if it is null
 */

signature: protected List<String> tokenize(final char[] chars, final int offset, final int count)
name: tokenize
javadoc:
/**
 * Tokenizes a character array into a list of strings.
 *
 * @param chars The character array to tokenize.
 * @param offset The starting index in the character array.
 * @param count The number of characters to tokenize.
 * @return A list of strings representing the tokenized characters.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Tokenizes a specified portion of a character array into a list of strings,
 * using the provided offset and count to determine the range of characters
 * to be tokenized.
 *
 * @param chars The character array to tokenize.
 * @param offset The starting index in the character array (inclusive).
 * @param count The number of characters to tokenize, starting from the specified offset.
 * @return A list of strings representing the tokenized characters.
 */

name: flush
javadoc:
/**
 * Flushes any pending output.
 *
 * This method does not perform any actual flushing, as it simply does nothing.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Flushes any pending output by performing an actual flush operation on the underlying stream.
 *
 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during the flush operation
 */

signature: public void write(final String str, final int off, final int len)
name: write
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a substring of the given string to this text builder.
 *
 * @param str  the string from which the substring is taken
 * @param off  the starting offset in the string (inclusive)
 * @param len  the length of the substring
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a specified portion of the given string to this text builder.
 *
 * @param str   the input string from which the substring is taken
 * @param off   the starting offset in the string (inclusive), must be non-negative and not greater than the length of the string
 * @param len   the length of the substring, must be non-negative and not greater than the remaining characters in the string
 *
 * @throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException if the specified offset or length is invalid
 */

signature: private static int createPositiveCapacity(final int minCapacity)
name: createPositiveCapacity
javadoc:
/**
 * Calculates a positive capacity based on the minimum required capacity.
 *
 * @param minCapacity the minimum required capacity; may not be negative
 * @return the calculated capacity, which is either the maximum of the minimum capacity and the maximum buffer size,
 *         or Integer.MAX_VALUE if the minimum capacity exceeds the maximum buffer size
 * @throws OutOfMemoryError if the minimum capacity is negative (indicating an overflow)
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Calculates a positive capacity based on the minimum required capacity.
 *
 * This method ensures that the calculated capacity is sufficient to accommodate all elements, while also preventing
 * potential buffer overflows. If the minimum capacity exceeds the maximum buffer size, it returns Integer.MAX_VALUE,
 * indicating an overflow condition.
 *
 * @param minCapacity the minimum required capacity; must be non-negative
 * @return the calculated capacity, which is either the maximum of the minimum capacity and the maximum buffer size,
 *         or Integer.MAX_VALUE if the minimum capacity exceeds the maximum buffer size
 * @throws OutOfMemoryError if the minimum capacity is negative (indicating an overflow)
 */

signature: public static TextStringBuilder wrap(final char[] initialBuffer, final int length)
name: wrap
javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a new instance of TextStringBuilder with the specified initial buffer and length.
 *
 * @param initialBuffer The character array to use as the initial buffer for this text string builder.
 * @param length The length of the initial buffer.
 * @return A new instance of TextStringBuilder.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a new instance of TextStringBuilder with the specified initial buffer and length.
 *
 * @param initialBuffer  The character array to use as the initial buffer for this text string builder. 
 *                       This buffer will be used to store characters before they are appended to the end of the buffer.
 * @param length         The length of the initial buffer, which determines its capacity.
 * @return               A new instance of TextStringBuilder with the specified initial buffer and length.
 */

signature: public TextStringBuilder append(final TextStringBuilder str, final int startIndex, final int length)
name: append
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a substring of another TextStringBuilder to the end of this string.
 *
 * @param str  the text string builder from which the substring is taken
 * @param startIndex  the starting index in the source string (inclusive)
 * @param length  the number of characters to append
 * @return this TextStringBuilder object
 * @throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException if the start index or length is invalid
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a substring of another TextStringBuilder to the end of this string.
 *
 * @param str  the text string builder from which the substring is taken
 * @param startIndex  the starting index in the source string (inclusive)
 * @param length  the number of characters to append, must be non-negative and not greater than the length of the source string minus the start index
 * @return this TextStringBuilder object
 * @throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException if the start index is less than 0 or greater than the length of the source string, or if the length is negative or greater than the length of the source string minus the start index
 */

name: appendAll
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends all elements of the given array to this text string builder.
 *
 * @param array The array containing elements to be appended. May contain null or empty arrays, in which case no
 *              elements will be appended.
 * @return This text string builder instance for method chaining.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends all non-null elements of the given array to this text string builder.
 *
 * @param array The array containing elements to be appended. May contain null or empty arrays, in which case no
 *              elements will be appended.
 * @return This text string builder instance for method chaining.
 */

name: appendFalse
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends the string "false" to the buffer at the specified index.
 *
 * @param index The starting index in the buffer where the string should be appended.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends the literal boolean value false as a string to the buffer at the specified index.
 *
 * @param index The starting index in the buffer where the string should be appended.
 */

signature: public TextStringBuilder appendFixedWidthPadLeft(final Object obj, final int width, final char padChar)
name: appendFixedWidthPadLeft
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a fixed-width left-padded string representation of the specified object to this text builder.
 *
 * @param obj  the object to append as a string, or {@code null} if the object is {@code null}
 * @param width  the minimum number of characters in the resulting string; must be greater than zero
 * @param padChar  the character used for padding; must not be {@code null}; typically a space (' ') or a tab ('\t')
 *
 * @return this text builder, allowing method chaining
 */

signature: public TextStringBuilder appendFixedWidthPadRight(final Object obj, final int width, final char padChar)
name: appendFixedWidthPadRight
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a fixed-width padded string to the end of this text builder.
 *
 * @param obj  the object to be converted and appended, or null if an empty string should be used
 * @param width  the minimum number of characters in the resulting string
 * @param padChar  the character to use for padding (if necessary)
 *
 * @return this text builder instance
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a fixed-width padded string representation of the specified object to the end of this text builder.
 *
 * If the object is null, an empty string will be appended. The resulting string will have at least the specified minimum width,
 * with the specified padding character used if necessary.
 *
 * @param obj  the object to be converted and appended (or null for an empty string)
 * @param width  the minimum number of characters in the resulting string
 * @param padChar  the character to use for padding (if necessary)
 *
 * @return this text builder instance
 */

signature: public TextStringBuilder appendln(final TextStringBuilder str, final int startIndex, final int length)
name: appendln
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a substring of another text string builder to this one.
 *
 * @param str  the text string builder from which to append
 * @param startIndex  the starting index in the source string (inclusive)
 * @param length  the number of characters to append
 * @return this text string builder with the appended substring and newline character
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a specified portion of another text string to this one.
 *
 * @param str        the source text string from which to append
 * @param startIndex the starting index in the source string (inclusive)
 * @param length     the number of characters to append, or -1 for all remaining characters
 * @return          this text string builder with the appended substring and newline character
 */

name: appendNewLine
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a new line to the text string builder.
 *
 * If no newline character has been set, it appends the system's default
 * newline separator. Otherwise, it appends the previously set newline character.
 *
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a new line to the text string builder using either the system's default 
 * newline separator or the previously set newline character if one has been specified.
 *
 * @param newlineCharacter the custom newline character to use (optional)
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */

name: appendNull
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a null text to the string builder.
 *
 * If {@code nullText} has not been set, this method returns the current
 * instance without modifying it. Otherwise, it appends the value of
 * {@code nullText} to the end of the string builder.
 *
 * @return This string builder instance or a new one if {@code nullText}
 *         is appended.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a null text to the string builder, returning either this instance
 * (if no null text has been set) or a new instance with the null text appended.
 *
 * @return This string builder instance if no null text has been set,
 *         otherwise a new instance with the null text appended.
 */

signature: public TextStringBuilder appendPadding(final int length, final char padChar)
name: appendPadding
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends the specified number of occurrences of a character to the end of this string builder.
 *
 * @param length   the number of characters to append
 * @param padChar  the character to append
 * @return this TextStringBuilder object
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends the specified number of occurrences of a given character to the end of this string builder.
 *
 * @param length   the number of characters to append (must be non-negative)
 * @param padChar  the character to append (may not be null, but will be converted to a char if necessary)
 * @return this TextStringBuilder object
 */

signature: public TextStringBuilder appendSeparator(final String standard, final String defaultIfEmpty)
name: appendSeparator
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends a separator to the text builder.
 *
 * If the current text is empty, the {@code defaultIfEmpty} value will be used as the separator.
 * Otherwise, the {@code standard} separator will be appended.
 *
 * @param standard  the standard separator to use if the current text is not empty
 * @param defaultIfEmpty  the separator to use if the current text is empty
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends either the standard or default separator to the text builder, depending on whether the current text is empty.
 *
 * If the current text is not empty, the provided {@code standard} separator will be appended. Otherwise, the provided
 * {@code defaultIfEmpty} value will be used as the separator.
 *
 * @param standard  the separator to use if the current text is not empty
 * @param defaultIfEmpty  the separator to use if the current text is empty
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */

signature: public void appendTo(final Appendable appendable) throws IOException
name: appendTo
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends this buffer's content to the specified {@code Appendable}.
 *
 * @param appendable the target {@link Appendable} to which the buffer's content will be appended.
 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while writing to the target {@code Appendable}.
 */
improved_javadoc: INVALID FORMAT

name: appendTrue
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends the string "true" to the buffer at the specified index.
 *
 * @param index The index in the buffer where the string should be appended.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends the string "true" to the buffer at the specified index, effectively setting a boolean value to true.
 *
 * @param index The index in the buffer where the string should be appended. This method will overwrite any existing content at this index.
 * @return This method does not return anything meaningful; it modifies the buffer in place.
 */

signature: public TextStringBuilder appendWithSeparators(final Object[] array, final String separator)
name: appendWithSeparators
javadoc:
/**
 * Appends elements of an array to this text string builder, separated by a specified separator.
 *
 * @param array  the array of objects to be appended
 * @param separator  the separator to use between elements (defaults to an empty string if null)
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Appends elements of an array to this text string builder, separated by a specified separator.
 *
 * @param array  the array of objects to be appended (may be null if no elements are to be added)
 * @param separator  the separator to use between elements; may be null for default behavior (empty string)
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */

name: asReader
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a {@link Reader} that reads from this text string builder.
 *
 * @return A reader that reads from this text string builder.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a character stream that reads from this character sequence.
 *
 * @return  A character input stream that reads from this character sequence.
 */

name: asTokenizer
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a {@link StringTokenizer} instance for this text.
 *
 * @return A new {@link StringTokenizer} instance, which can be used to tokenize
 *         the text into individual tokens.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Creates and returns a new {@link StringTokenizer} instance that tokenizes the given text into individual tokens.
 *
 * @return A newly created {@link StringTokenizer} instance, which can be used to tokenize the text.
 */

name: asWriter
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a {@link Writer} that writes to this builder.
 *
 * @return A writer that writes to this builder.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a {@link java.io.Writer} that writes to this builder, allowing for fluent API usage.
 *
 * @return A {@code Writer} instance that writes to this builder.
 */

name: build
javadoc:
/**
 * Builds and returns a string representation of this object.
 *
 * @return A string representation of this object.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a string representation of this object, including its class name,
 * hash code, and other relevant details. The format of the string is determined
 * by the {@link Object#toString()} method.
 *
 * @return A string representation of this object.
 */

name: capacity
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the current capacity of this buffer.
 *
 * The capacity is the number of elements that can be stored in the buffer
 * without needing to reallocate memory.
 *
 * @return the current capacity of this buffer
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the current capacity of this buffer, which represents the maximum 
 * number of elements that can be stored in the buffer before it needs to be resized.
 *
 * @return the current capacity of this buffer
 */

name: charAt
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the character at the specified index in the buffer.
 *
 * @param index the index of the character to be returned
 * @return the character at the specified index
 * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= length())
 */
improved_javadoc: INVALID FORMAT

name: clear
javadoc:
/**
 * Clears the text builder, resetting its internal state to empty.
 *
 * @return This text builder instance for chaining convenience.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Resets the text builder's internal state to an empty string, effectively clearing any previously built content.
 *
 * @return This text builder instance, allowing for method chaining to build new content.
 */

name: contains
javadoc:
/**
 * Checks if a string matches the given {@link StringMatcher}.
 *
 * @param matcher the string matcher to check against
 * @return true if the string matches the matcher, false otherwise
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Verifies whether a specified input string conforms to the defined pattern or criteria as per the provided {@link StringMatcher}.
 *
 * @param matcher the StringMatcher instance that defines the matching criteria
 * @return true if the input string matches the specified pattern, false otherwise
 */

signature: public TextStringBuilder delete(final int startIndex, final int endIndex)
name: delete
javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes a range of characters from the text.
 *
 * @param startIndex The starting index of the range to be deleted (inclusive).
 * @param endIndex   The ending index of the range to be deleted (exclusive).
 * @return This TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes a specified range of characters from this text, inclusive of the start index and exclusive of the end index.
 *
 * @param startIndex The starting index (inclusive) of the character range to be deleted.
 * @param endIndex   The ending index (exclusive) of the character range to be deleted.
 * @return This TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining.
 */

name: deleteAll
javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes all occurrences of a specified pattern from this text string builder.
 *
 * @param matcher the pattern to match and delete
 * @return this text string builder with the matched patterns deleted
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes all occurrences of a specified regular expression pattern from this text string builder.
 *
 * @param pattern the regular expression pattern to match and delete
 * @return this text string builder with the matched patterns deleted
 */

name: deleteCharAt
javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes a character at the specified index.
 *
 * @param index the index of the character to be deleted (0-based)
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Removes the character at the specified index from this text string builder.
 * 
 * If the index is out of range (less than 0 or greater than or equal to the current length), 
 * an {@link IndexOutOfBoundsException} is thrown.
 *
 * @param index the index of the character to be removed (0-based)
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */

name: deleteFirst
javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes the first occurrence of a specified pattern from this text string builder.
 *
 * @param matcher the pattern to match and delete
 * @return this text string builder with the matched pattern deleted
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes the first occurrence of a specified regular expression pattern from this text string buffer.
 *
 * @param matcher the regular expression pattern to match and delete, which must not be null
 * @return this text string buffer with the matched pattern deleted
 */

signature: private void deleteImpl(final int startIndex, final int endIndex, final int len)
name: deleteImpl
javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes a portion of the buffer.
 *
 * This method shifts all elements after the deletion point to fill the gap,
 * effectively reducing the size of the buffer by the number of deleted elements.
 *
 * @param startIndex The starting index of the range to delete (inclusive).
 * @param endIndex   The ending index of the range to delete (exclusive).
 * @param len        The length of the range to delete.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Deletes a portion of the buffer, shifting all elements after the deletion point
 * to fill the gap and reducing the size of the buffer by the number of deleted elements.
 *
 * @param startIndex The starting index (inclusive) of the range to delete from the buffer.
 * @param endIndex   The ending index (exclusive) of the range to delete from the buffer.
 * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code startIndex} or {@code endIndex} is out of bounds,
 *                                   or if {@code startIndex} is greater than {@code endIndex}.
 */

name: drainChar
javadoc:
/**
 * Retrieves and removes a character at the specified index from the buffer.
 *
 * @param index the index of the character to be retrieved
 * @return the character at the specified index
 * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Retrieves and removes a character at the specified index from the buffer.
 *
 * This method returns the character at the given {@code index} in the buffer, 
 * effectively removing it. The returned character is the one that was previously 
 * stored at the specified position. If the provided index is greater than or equal 
 * to the current size of the buffer, this method throws an {@link IndexOutOfBoundsException}.
 *
 * @param index the zero-based index of the character to be retrieved and removed
 * @return the character at the specified index in the buffer
 * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range (i.e., greater than or equal to the current size of the buffer)
 */

signature: public int drainChars(final int startIndex, final int endIndex, final char[] target, final int targetIndex)
name: drainChars
javadoc:
/**
 * Drains characters from this character sequence into a specified array.
 *
 * @param startIndex the starting index in this character sequence to drain from
 * @param endIndex the ending index in this character sequence to drain up to (exclusive)
 * @param target the array to store the drained characters
 * @param targetIndex the index in the target array where draining should start
 * @return the number of characters actually drained into the target array
 * @throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException if the specified range exceeds the bounds of this character sequence
 */
improved_javadoc: INVALID FORMAT

name: endsWith
javadoc:
/**
 * Checks if this buffer ends with the specified string.
 *
 * @param str the string to check against
 * @return {@code true} if this buffer ends with the specified string, otherwise {@code false}
 * @throws NullPointerException if the input string is null
 */

name: ensureCapacity
javadoc:
/**
 * Ensures that the internal buffer has at least the specified capacity.
 *
 * @param capacity the minimum capacity to be ensured
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Ensures that the internal buffer has a sufficient capacity by resizing it if necessary, 
 * guaranteeing that at least the specified number of characters can be appended without 
 * requiring further reallocations.
 *
 * @param capacity the minimum capacity to ensure (inclusive)
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance for method chaining
 */

name: ensureCapacityInternal
javadoc:
/**
 * Ensures that the internal buffer has sufficient capacity to hold the specified number of elements.
 *
 * @param capacity the minimum capacity required by the buffer
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Ensures that the internal buffer has sufficient capacity to hold the specified number of elements.
 *
 * @param capacity the minimum capacity required by the buffer
 * @return true if the buffer's capacity was increased, false otherwise
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the requested capacity is less than 0
 */

name: equals
javadoc:
/**
 * Compares this TextStringBuilder with another.
 *

 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Compares this TextStringBuilder instance with the specified object for equality.
 *

name: equalsIgnoreCase

/**

 * @param other the TextStringBuilder to compare with

improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Compares this text string builder to another, ignoring case differences.
 *
 * @param other the TextStringBuilder object to compare with, not null
 * @return true if the two strings are equal, ignoring case; false otherwise
 */

name: get
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a string representation of this object.
 *
 * @return  a string representation of this object
 */

name: getBuffer
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the character array used as a buffer.
 *
 * @return The character array used as a buffer.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the character array used as a buffer, which can be modified by the user to store arbitrary data.
 *
 * @return The character array used as a buffer. This array may have been previously initialized with a default value or populated with data from a previous operation.
 */

signature: public void getChars(final int startIndex, final int endIndex, final char[] target, final int targetIndex)
name: getChars
javadoc:
/**
 * Copies characters from this string into the given array.
 *
 * @param startIndex the starting index (inclusive) of the substring to copy
 * @param endIndex   the ending index (exclusive) of the substring to copy
 * @param target     the character array to copy into
 * @param targetIndex the starting index in the target array where copying begins
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Copies a range of characters from this string into the specified character array.
 *
 * The substring to be copied starts at the {@code startIndex} (inclusive) and ends at the {@code endIndex} (exclusive).
 * The characters are copied into the {@code target} array, starting at the index {@code targetIndex}.
 *
 * @param startIndex the starting index (inclusive) of the substring to copy
 * @param endIndex   the ending index (exclusive) of the substring to copy
 * @param target     the character array to copy into
 * @param targetIndex the starting index in the target array where copying begins
 */

name: getNewLineText
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the text of a new line.
 *

name: hashCode
javadoc:
/** * Returns a hash code value for the object. * * This implementation uses a variant of the "distributive" hash function * that is designed to produce a good distribution of hash values across * the entire range of possible values. The hash code is computed as * follows: * *
    *
  • Initializes the result to 0.
    • *
  • Iterates over each character in the buffer, multiplying the * current result by 31 and adding the value of the current character. *
    • *
* * @return a hash code value for this object. */

signature: public String midString(int index, final int length)
name: midString
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a substring of this string from the specified {@code index} to the end,
 * or up to a maximum of {@code length} characters.
 *
 * If the {@code index} is negative, it is treated as 0. If the {@code length}
 * is less than or equal to 0, an empty string is returned. If the {@code index}
 * plus {@code length} exceeds the size of this string, a substring from
 * {@code index} to the end of the string is returned.
 *
 * @param index the starting index of the substring (inclusive)
 * @param length the maximum length of the substring
 * @return a substring of this string
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a substring of this string from the specified {@code index} to the end,
 * or up to a maximum of {@code length} characters.

 * is less than or equal to 0, an empty string is returned. If the {@code index}
 * plus {@code length} exceeds the size of this string, a substring from
 * {@code index} to the end of the string is returned.
 *
 * @param index the starting index (inclusive) of the substring in the range [0, {@link String#length()}]
 * @param length the maximum number of characters in the substring; must be non-negative

 */

name: minimizeCapacity

 *
 * If the buffer's length exceeds the current size, it will be reallocated
 * to match the size. This method is useful for reducing memory usage when
 * the text string builder's size has been reduced.
 *
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance, allowing for method chaining.
 */

 * and memory usage needs to be minimized.

 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance, enabling method chaining.
 */

signature:

name: replace
javadoc:
/**
 * Replaces occurrences of a specified pattern in this text with a replacement string.
 *
 * @param matcher  The pattern to match and replace.
 * @param replaceStr  The string to use as a replacement.
 * @param startIndex  The starting index (inclusive) where replacements should begin.
 * @param endIndex    The ending index (exclusive) where replacements should end.
 * @param replaceCount  The maximum number of occurrences to replace.

 */
improved_javadoc:

 * within a specified range and up to a maximum number of replacements.
 *
 * @param matcher  The regular expression pattern to match and replace.
 * @param replaceStr  The string to use as a replacement for each matched occurrence.
 * @param startIndex  The starting index (inclusive) where replacements should begin.
 * @param endIndex    The ending index (exclusive) where replacements should end.
 * @param replaceCount  The maximum number of occurrences to replace, or -1 for unlimited replacements.
 *
 * @return A new TextStringBuilder with the replacements made.
 *
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the range specified by startIndex and endIndex is invalid,
 *                                  or if replaceCount is negative and not equal to -1.
 */

 *
 * @param matcher The regular expression pattern to match and replace, which must be compiled into a Pattern object using {@link java.util.regex.Pattern#compile(String)} or a similar method.
 * @param replaceStr The string to use as a replacement for the matched pattern. This can contain placeholders for the matched groups, such as $1, $2, etc., which will be replaced with their corresponding group values.
 * @return A new TextStringBuilder instance containing the modified text, where the first occurrence of the specified pattern has been replaced with the given replacement string.
 */

signature:
private TextStringBuilder replaceImpl(final StringMatcher matcher, final String replaceStr, final int from, int to,
        int replaceCount)
name: replaceImpl
javadoc:
/**
 * Replaces occurrences of a pattern in the text with a replacement string.
 *
 * @param matcher the pattern to match, must not be null
 * @param replaceStr the replacement string, may be null
 * @param from the starting index (inclusive) of the search range
 * @param to the ending index (exclusive) of the search range
 * @param replaceCount the maximum number of replacements to make
 *
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Replaces occurrences of a specified pattern in the text with a replacement string.
 *
 * The replacement operation is performed within the specified range, starting from the given index and ending at the specified end index (exclusive).
 * If the replaceCount parameter is greater than 0, only up to that number of replacements are made. 
 * If null is passed as the matcher or replaceStr parameters, no replacements will be made.
 *
 * @param matcher the pattern to match, must not be null
 * @param replaceStr the replacement string, may be null
 * @param from the starting index (inclusive) of the search range
 * @param to the ending index (exclusive) of the search range
 * @param replaceCount the maximum number of replacements to make
 *
 * @return this TextStringBuilder instance
 */

name: resizeBuffer

 *
 * This method is used to dynamically resize the internal buffer to ensure it can hold at least the specified number of elements.
 * It takes into account both overflow and underflow conditions, ensuring that the new capacity is sufficient but not excessive.
 *
 * @param minCapacity The minimum capacity required for the buffer
 */
